page.title: 11Agriculture near Mexborough
page.content: Farming in our area is mostly arable "Arable" means crop farming. We have a few beef and dairy cattle and a few sheep. We grow four crops down in the Dearne valley: winter wheat, winter barley, oil seed rape and potatoes. Up on the limestone ridge we have noticed two other crops: oats and turnips. We think the crops up on the ridge are different because of the limestone under the soil which makes the soil different.The crops in the valley grow in soil which is on the sandstone.Land has been reclaimed on an old pit tip near our nature reserve.It is now used for sheep grazing.New trees have also been planted on it.On all the old maps it said that the land near the river was liable to flood but now that the land has been drained by the new cut of the Dearne,crops are now able to be grown in the land that is drained.
